titles.title: A resolution to state the guiding principles of United States policy toward South Africa's illegal occupation of Namibia.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

bill.summary: 7/23/1987--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that the President should: (1) recognize the legitimacy of the plight of the Namibian people; (2) urge the Government of South Africa to take actions to end its illegal occupation of that country and to implement United Nations Security Council Resolution 435; (3) take a role in pursuing resumption of negotiations between South Africa and the leaders of the Namibian people; (4) reject any policy which links the implementation of Resolution 435 to the withdrawal of Cuban troops from Angola; and (5) call for the termination of U.S. business in Namibia until South Africa complies with Resolution 435.
